elements.title: Tanz im August (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tanz im August, an annual international festival of contemporary dance in Berlin, was founded by Nele Hertling (pictured) in 1988?

elements.title: George McCubbin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 18-year-old George McCubbin piloted the aircraft that shot down German ace Max Immelmann in 1916?

elements.title: Chevelon Creek Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Chevelon Creek Bridge, built in Arizona in 1912–1913, was part of one of America's first national highways?

elements.title: Franz Josef Altenburg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ceramicist Franz Josef Altenburg was honoured with an exhibition of his art at Austria's Kaiservilla where he was born?

elements.title: Day of Reckoning (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a television in the film Day of Reckoning includes scenes from Big Ass Spider!?

elements.title: Safad El Battikh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Southern Lebanese villages of Safad El Battikh, Kafra and Ayta al-Jabal were mentioned in 1596 Ottoman tax records?

elements.title: Lucien Brouha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Harvard step test, developed by Lucien Brouha in 1942, is still used as a reference when developing fitness tests?

elements.title: actual play (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actual play shows have helped to improve the representation of women, people of color, and LGBT people in tabletop gaming?
